ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Serious Everquest question, please help
ygData.msgSnippet: No, you don t lose your equipment if you get killed. It stays on your corpse until you loot it, but at levels lower than 5 (or maybe 5 and lower) your corpse,
ygData.messageBody:
No, you don't lose your equipment if you get killed. It stays on your corpse until you loot it, but at levels lower than 5 (or maybe 5 and lower) your corpse, with all your equipment, will poof after half an hour of game time or 24 hours of real time if you are not logged on. I think that is intended to discourage low level characters from wandering too far from home.
 
If you got killed a second time going after your first corpse and you had nothing on the second corpse, that corpse might poof within a few minutes (not sure), but your first corpse with your gear on it would stick around for the allotted half hour.
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Minigamer
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, January 06, 2002 2:24 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Serious Everquest question, please help

Thanks, Solid advice to me.
So, it sounds like when I die, I would lose mets say a shield and sword then?
If so, then I get it now.

Thanks
----- Original Message -----
From: Su
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, January 06, 2002 12:19 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Serious Everquest question, please help

>Hi all,
>Forgive my ignorance but I am a newbie had a 4th level Druid in the city of
Elves and while out at the Orc >Camp, with others, I got killed by an Orc
Centurian and when I returned to get my corpse, nothing was >there.  It was
not more than 4 minutes when I returned.
>
No problem. All of us were newbies once.
>
>Question: Is it possible for someone to Steal or Loot my corpse? The book
says no but I beg to differ.
>Is it possible that I had two corpses out there? Meaning, When I went back
with a dead body I died again?  >Which meant I found the wrong corpse?
>
You must have found the second corpse. It can be tough sometimes getting the
right corpse if you die more than once. And sometimes if you don't have any
items other than foraged food, you lose the foraged stuff anyways and just
get back the food you started with. Up to level 5 I think you get your
food/drink and tome of discord back. I think your starting weapon too.
>
>And to add one last question, "what do I do now? seeing as I have no food,
no money, no nothing?"  Do I >beg or do I start another char?
>This game is totally fun but with the fact of trying to learn which way to
go all the time and dying, it is starting >to get to me,
>I don't want to give up just yet and I turned to this board since the Chat
from the game options was >USELESS.
>
Well, if it bugs you that much, you can start over again. But even if you
lose everything, at that low level you can just keep the character and just
build your items and such back up again. I recommend that you not carry
anything you really don't want to lose until you get level 6. Keep
everything else in the bank. Especially your money. Oh, and practice
foraging alot. It will help you later on in the game. Trust me. Begging is
not a good idea. Begging tend to piss people off. And you might want to
avoid orc camps at that level. at least stay close to the lift with a good
group and have someone to pull wandering orc cents. I think even some orc
pawns might give you xp at that level.
>
>Please help and Thanks in advance
>Rob
>
You're welcome.
luv,
-Su
